stream_context.summary: Kaze blocked-out the overworld and methodically solved several design problems: how to enter the Wing-Cap stage without a height-gaining power-up, how to give coins real value via shops, and how to stage the mid-game Yoshi-Bowser boss fight inside the overworld. He iterated on map layout for Parts 9–13, showed the game running at 60 FPS on real hardware, and discussed gating so players aren’t overwhelmed by too many unlocked regions at once.

development_findings.summary: Cloud-Cap power-up was removed from the overworld because it lets players fly over walls and see unmodelled areas.
development_findings.quote: Having the cloud-cap in the overworld is going to break all the visuals… we can't have that.

development_findings.summary: New Wing-Cap entry plan: a baby-Yoshi crib inside the Yoshi-house shrinks Mario and warps him to the rooftop stage; access is hinted by balloons released during the Star Festival.
development_findings.quote: The Yoshi room now has a baby Yoshi crib; walking at it will shrink you into it, warping you to the rooftop stage.

development_findings.summary: Yoshi-coin relocation & balloon mechanic: a Toad inflates balloons in Acts 1-2; seals carry balloons in Act 3. Popping any balloon makes it rise into the relocated coin so it’s collectible in every act.
Coin economy added: a Bob-omb cannon operator will charge 200 coins; more overworld shops are planned so coins feel valuable.
development_findings.quote: We definitely need to add shops… otherwise you’re gonna go your whole life collecting coins not knowing what they're for.

development_findings.summary: Overworld events grant stars and permanently change geography (e.g., pirate attack leaves a sunken ship; future heavy-rain or mushroom events are brainstormed).
development_findings.quote: Events need to be something you beat and then they give you a star and permanently change the overworld.

development_findings.summary: Mid-game Bowser fight: ‘Yoshi-Bowser’ appears in Part 6 after he eats the island’s heart; fight area will be an apple/melon garden that wilts and is ringed by thorn-bush barriers during the battle.
development_findings.quote: We can put plants here and then wilt the plants… Bowser destroys them during the fight.

development_findings.summary: Entire overworld will be one seamless map without warp transitions.
development_findings.quote: The entire overworld is going to be one huge map that’s seamless.

development_findings.summary: Performance milestone: game runs at 60 FPS (58 with AA, 52 in widescreen) on real N64 hardware even when rendering 50 Goombas.
development_findings.quote: Look—60 FPS… If you have a widescreen TV you can even turn on widescreen and it’s still 62 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Course entrances after Bowser 2 currently unlock five overworld parts at once; Kaze considers adding gating to Part 13 to avoid player choice-paralysis.
development_findings.quote: It’s a little much… that’s going to give some players choice paralysis.

development_findings.summary: Collision system is custom and separate from standard SM64; Kaze often waits for Biobak’s visual rework before rebuilding collision maps.

context_findings.summary: Video editing for upcoming Saturday video is costly; Kaze finances it through sponsorships and hopes for at least 1 M views.
context_findings.quote: At this point I have to finance my video editing with sponsor deals… it was very expensive.

context_findings.summary: He wants coins to matter because Zelda rupees now feel useless to him.
context_findings.quote: I do want there to be more overworld shops. This is a complaint I have playing almost all Zelda games nowadays—rupees don’t do anything anymore.

context_findings.summary: Shows pride in technical optimisation; demoing 60 FPS on real hardware boosted his motivation.
Expresses worry about Nintendo legal action and muses about re-theming the game if necessary.
context_findings.quote: Nintendo might just murder me… Maybe I should do that before I release it.

context_findings.summary: Personal moment: Zeina (his wife) cut his hair to save barbershop money; chat reacts positively.
context_findings.quote: My wife did it—I am too cheap to go to a barber.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on chaos hacks: humour should combine effects to create new gameplay, not recycle old jokes.
context_findings.quote: Making a chaos hack is all about telling a joke that the audience will laugh at at the expense of the streamer… this just didn’t happen.

biobak.summary: Reworking multiple level models, including Koopa Wave Cove, Course 11, and general foliage; his visual pass often precedes Kaze’s collision work.
biobak.quote: This level actually looked decent before Biobak reworked it… it’s a lot more cloudy right now.

biobak.summary: Taught Kaze the ‘Ctrl-E then C’ modelling shortcut, now used frequently.
Kaze flagged that some of Biobak’s bushes in the zoo level feel out of place; will need refinement.
biobak.quote: The bushes in the zoo level don’t really fit the level.

badub.summary: Currently experimenting with overworld music; Kaze defers to him on final track selection and mixing.
badub.quote: Badub’s working with music a little bit, trying to figure out what would work for the overworld.

zeina.summary: Provides personal support and minor concept art; cut Kaze’s hair; may have sketched gondola idea.

key_stories.title: Scrapping the Cloud-Cap
key_stories.summary: Original plan placed a Cloud-Cap box in the overworld so players could fly into the Wing-Cap stage, but it let them break camera illusions. Kaze analysed the risk, removed the item, and brainstormed alternatives.
key_stories.challenge: Cloud-Cap exposed unmodeled areas and ‘broke the magic.’
key_stories.process: Evaluated Yoshi mounts, Bee power-up, higher walls; rejected all. Brainstormed events, shops, balloons, and finally the baby-Yoshi crib warp.
key_stories.outcome: Decided on crib-based shrink warp plus balloon-themed hint, preserving visual integrity.
key_stories.key_quote: Having the cloud-cap in the overworld is going to be awkward… we need an alternate way to enter the Wing-Cap level.

key_stories.title: Adding Real Currency Value
key_stories.summary: Coins previously lacked purpose. Kaze invented overworld shops starting with a Bob-omb cannon fee and plans more purchasable events.
key_stories.challenge: Players would collect coins endlessly without knowing why.
key_stories.process: Discussed Zelda’s rupee problem, listed potential sellers (Peggy Derm, cannon Bob-omb), priced services.
key_stories.outcome: Coins now unlock level access and future events, giving them tangible value.
key_stories.key_quote: We definitely need to add shops; otherwise you’re gonna go your whole life collecting coins not knowing what they’re for.

key_stories.title: Designing the Yoshi-Bowser Overworld Battle
key_stories.summary: Mid-game boss fight must take place in the open overworld without seeming pre-planned.
key_stories.challenge: Arena had to be flat for gameplay yet visually interesting and narratively justified.
key_stories.process: Relocated Super Happy Tree, turned area into an apple/melon orchard. During the fight, plants wilt and thorn bushes spawn as barriers.
key_stories.outcome: Arena fits story context, provides visual transformation, and blocks player escape.
key_stories.key_quote: This part is an apple tree garden at first; during the fight all the trees are wilted and Bowser destroys them.

open_questions.context: Kaze wants pirates to attack shoreline, leaving a sunken ship that grants a star and maybe links to Wing-Cap unlock.
questions: What is the gameplay loop of defeating pirates?
Does it permanently alter traversal (e.g., new platforms)?

open_questions.context: Only one confirmed purchase (200-coin cannon). Kaze intends ‘many’ shops but specifics are vague.
questions: How many shop locations are planned and where?
What items/services will be sold beyond gate access?
Will coins ever be scarce enough to force choices?

open_questions.context: Unlocking five overworld parts after Bowser 2 may overwhelm players.
questions: What mechanic or narrative beat will block Part 13?
Could gating tie into coin shops or events?
Will other parts be staggered similarly?

open_questions.context: Kaze says many unique mechanics will need sounds but details are undecided.
questions: Which new power-ups or enemies require bespoke SFX?
Who is responsible for creating/implementing them?
Will they mimic Yoshi’s Island aesthetics or be novel?

open_questions.context: Kaze jokes about Nintendo ‘murdering’ him and possibly re-theming the game.
questions: Is there a concrete fallback plan if Nintendo serves a takedown?
Would re-theming mean new characters and branding?
How much work would re-authoring assets require?
